intro: Lacistema berteroanum, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to South America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shady habitats and has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dry seeds. Lacistema berteroanum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and naturalized areas.
